# sec_identity_access_certificates(_:_:) | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ Security ](/documentation/security)

- [ sec_identity_access_certificates(_:_:) ](/documentation/Security/sec_identity_access_certificates(_:_:))

-  sec_identity_access_certificates(_:_:) 

Function# sec_identity_access_certificates(_:_:)

iOS 13.0+iPadOS 13.0+Mac Catalyst 13.1+macOS 10.15+tvOS 13.0+visionOS 1.0+watchOS 6.0+

```
func sec_identity_access_certificates(
    _ identity: sec_identity_t,
    _ handler: @escaping (sec_certificate_t) -> Void
) -> Bool
```

## [ Parameters ](/documentation/Security/sec_identity_access_certificates(_:_:)#parameters)

`identity`A `sec_identity_t` instance.

`handler`A block to invoke one or more times with `sec_certificate_t` instances.

## [Return Value](/documentation/Security/sec_identity_access_certificates(_:_:)#return-value)

Returns true if the peer certificates were accessible, false otherwise.

## [Discussion](/documentation/Security/sec_identity_access_certificates(_:_:)#discussion)

Access the certificates associated with the `sec_identity_t` instance.
